chunks.en: Is being divorced better than being never married?
Has work experience
Don't use the company HR's process of evaluating people for matchmaking. Marriage is like a joint venture; you should use the venture capital due diligence approach.
I've seen a few divorced people, and they all basically have visible problems...
Learning something is

chunks.en: That's what my parents' generation thinks. Even if you're divorced, it's better than being single all the time. They can't accept others saying their children are unwanted; they can't save face.
Isn't there a joke? Matchmakers for divorced people with children will say they guarantee fertility.
@levelworm #21 Simply put, for divorced people, maybe 50% is the other personâ€™s problem. But for older singles, 100% is their own problem.
It depends on age. It's definitely like this for older people.
Has work experience +1

chunks.en: Divorced, unless you are rich, you will no longer be competitive, because there are definitely reasons for both parties in a divorce, which is not a good thing. Dating a divorced person, regardless of gender, will soon reveal why they divorced.
It doesn't seem to be like this here. Dating after a divorce is considered a second marriage, which is a negative.

It depends on gender, age, length of marriage, etc. Analyze the specific situation. If you don't consider these and think that being divorced is better than being never married, then you generally treat marriage as a task. It is indeed better to fail at it than not to do it at all, just like some old people always say, 'When you get married, my task is complete.' Of course, there will be another task after this one is completed.

chunks.en: Playing MMORPG, if you can't get the PVE main quest items, are you anxious when you're stuck at a level? If you can't beat others in PVP, are you anxious? ğŸ˜†
OP's question is naive. He obviously already feels pressured.

In the old mindset, under the same conditions, divorce is a debuff, regardless of the reason for the divorce. But at this stage, divorce and breakup are not much different, just an extra legally binding certificate, and the things that couples should do have long been done in advance. So I think they are about the same.
It can shut up some of the people who ask questions.
Thatâ€™s how it is for older people
@avrillavigne So, what is the tuition for Ge Erdan?ğŸ˜‚
That's how it is for older people (35+). Otherwise, people will suspect that there is a problem with your personality and will stay away.
That's the worldly view. Divorce can also be blamed on incompatibility, discovering problems with the person, etc. Being never married is simply considered unwanted.
